task_summary: Pick up the red block object from the table using a robot arm, starting with visual detection and ending with lifting once grasped.

task_long_description.overview: This episode tasks a robot arm with picking up a red, block-shaped object from a dark table surface. The scene contains one red block and several blue objects serving as distractors. The robot must first locate the red block visually, approach it from above, align and lower for stable grasp, then close its gripper to secure the object and finally lift it off the table. Constraints include precise localization and grasp stability, with quick acquisition and minimal retries.
preconditions: Red block is present and isolated on the table
Robot gripper is open and above table surface
No occlusions or obstructions in robot workspace
stepwise_plan: Visually check for the red block
Scan workspace if object not immediately visible
Detect exact location of red block
Move directly above target with adequate offset
Approach and align gripper with target
Lower gripper until gentle contact with the block
Close gripper to grasp with moderate force
Verify object is securely in gripper
Lift the grasped object off the table
success_criteria: Red block is lifted and held by gripper off table
No collisions occur with blue distractor objects
failure_and_recovery: Object detection failure: scan the workspace
Unstable grasp: abort and recover to home
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when the red block is securely held and raised at least 0.1m above table

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red block is visible to the robot.
Scans workspace to acquire red block if not initially visible.
Detects precise position of the red block.
Moves gripper above red block with 0.05m offset.
Computes top-down grasp pose for red block.
Approaches and aligns gripper to red block.
Lowers until gentle contact (5N threshold) with red block.
Closes gripper to grasp with 10N force.
Checks that the red block is contained in gripper.

failure_modes: Red block not detected or occluded
False positive on distractor blue objects
Gripper fails to close or object slips during lift
recovery_strategy: Retry scan if object not visible
Abort and reopen gripper if grasp fails
Re-align to target pose if object slips
assumptions: The red object is interpreted as 'red_block' per frame evidence, overriding lack of explicit object name in instruction.
No explicit place phase required: instruction is strictly pick up, and frames show only lifting; no subsequent placement.
Frames confirm only one red block is present as target, blue objects are non-target distractors.

expected_success_criteria: Red block is held in gripper above table at episode termination
